entry.title: Masked Goddess (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the holes in the Masked Goddess (pictured) helped prevent it from exploding during creation?

entry.title: a Wyoming TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a retired man with no previous broadcasting experience was offered a job by a Wyoming TV station after winning an "Anchorman for a Day" contest?

entry.title: Quia maior (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to Pope Innocent III's 1213 letter Quia maior, the number of the beast refers to the number of years since Muhammad's migration from Mecca to Medina?

entry.title: Trapeze (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Trapeze spreadsheet introduced the idea of blocks that InfoWorld called "revolutionary"?

entry.title: vanilla tlatepusco (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that euglossine bees distribute the seeds of vanilla tlatepusco?

entry.title: Hamish Campbell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New Zealand politician Hamish Campbell is a cancer researcher and runs a flower-delivery business?

entry.title: Fort Stonewall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Fort Stonewall was considered a model of river defense?

entry.title: Omi in a Hellcat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Omi in a Hellcat owned three Dodge Hellcats?
